name: 3 - 4 - 2.4 Evaluation of TR Systems (00-10-10).srt
text: [SOUND] This lecture is about

name: 3 - 4 - 2.4 Evaluation of TR Systems (00-10-10).srt
text: evaluation of text retrieval systems.

name: 3 - 4 - 2.4 Evaluation of TR Systems (00-10-10).srt
text: _In the previous lectures
column6: we have talked about a number of text retrieval methods. _

name: 3 - 4 - 2.4 Evaluation of TR Systems (00-10-10).srt
text: Different kinds of ranking functions.

name: 3 - 4 - 2.4 Evaluation of TR Systems (00-10-10).srt
text: But how do we know which one works the best?

name: 3 - 4 - 2.4 Evaluation of TR Systems (00-10-10).srt
text: _In order to answer this question
column6: we have to compare them

name: 3 - 4 - 2.4 Evaluation of TR Systems (00-10-10).srt
text: and that means we'll have to evaluate these retrieval methods.

name: 3 - 4 - 2.4 Evaluation of TR Systems (00-10-10).srt
text: So this is the main topic of this lecture.

name: 3 - 4 - 2.4 Evaluation of TR Systems (00-10-10).srt
text: _First
column6: let's think about why do we have to do evaluation? _

name: 3 - 4 - 2.4 Evaluation of TR Systems (00-10-10).srt
text: I already gave one reason.

name: 3 - 4 - 2.4 Evaluation of TR Systems (00-10-10).srt
text: _And that is

name: 3 - 4 - 2.4 Evaluation of TR Systems (00-10-10).srt
text: we have to use evaluation to figure out which retrieval method works better.

name: 3 - 4 - 2.4 Evaluation of TR Systems (00-10-10).srt
text: Now this is very important for advancing our knowledge.

name: 3 - 4 - 2.4 Evaluation of TR Systems (00-10-10).srt
text: Otherwise we wouldn't know whether a new idea works better than old idea.

name: 3 - 4 - 2.4 Evaluation of TR Systems (00-10-10).srt
text: _In the beginning of this course we talked about the

name: 3 - 4 - 2.4 Evaluation of TR Systems (00-10-10).srt
text: the problem of text retrieval we compare it with database retrieval.

name: 3 - 4 - 2.4 Evaluation of TR Systems (00-10-10).srt
text: _There
column6: we mentioned that text retrieval is imperative to find the problem. _

name: 3 - 4 - 2.4 Evaluation of TR Systems (00-10-10).srt
text: _So
column6: evaluation must rely on users

name: 3 - 4 - 2.4 Evaluation of TR Systems (00-10-10).srt
text: _which system works better
column6: that would have to be judged by our users. _

name: 3 - 4 - 2.4 Evaluation of TR Systems (00-10-10).srt
text: So this becomes very challenging problem.

name: 3 - 4 - 2.4 Evaluation of TR Systems (00-10-10).srt
text: _Because how can we get users involved in
column6: in matters

name: 3 - 4 - 2.4 Evaluation of TR Systems (00-10-10).srt
text: how can we draw a fair comparison of different methods.

name: 3 - 4 - 2.4 Evaluation of TR Systems (00-10-10).srt
text: So just go back to the reasons for evaluation.

name: 3 - 4 - 2.4 Evaluation of TR Systems (00-10-10).srt
text: I listed two reasons here.

name: 3 - 4 - 2.4 Evaluation of TR Systems (00-10-10).srt
text: _The second reason is basically what I just said but there is also another reason

name: 3 - 4 - 2.4 Evaluation of TR Systems (00-10-10).srt
text: which is to assess the actual utility of a test regional system.

name: 3 - 4 - 2.4 Evaluation of TR Systems (00-10-10).srt
text: Now imagine you're building your own applications.

name: 3 - 4 - 2.4 Evaluation of TR Systems (00-10-10).srt
text: Would be interested in knowing how well your search engine works for your users.

name: 3 - 4 - 2.4 Evaluation of TR Systems (00-10-10).srt
text: So in this case measures must

name: 3 - 4 - 2.4 Evaluation of TR Systems (00-10-10).srt
text: reflect the utility to the actual users in the the real application.

name: 3 - 4 - 2.4 Evaluation of TR Systems (00-10-10).srt
text: _And typically
column6: this has been done by using user studies and _

name: 3 - 4 - 2.4 Evaluation of TR Systems (00-10-10).srt
text: using the real search engine.

name: 3 - 4 - 2.4 Evaluation of TR Systems (00-10-10).srt
text: _In the second case or for the second reason
column6: the measures _

name: 3 - 4 - 2.4 Evaluation of TR Systems (00-10-10).srt
text: actually all need to be correlated with the utility to actual users.

name: 3 - 4 - 2.4 Evaluation of TR Systems (00-10-10).srt
text: _Thus they don't have to accurately reflect the
column6: the exact utility to users. _

name: 3 - 4 - 2.4 Evaluation of TR Systems (00-10-10).srt
text: So the measure only needs to be good enough to tell which method works better.

name: 3 - 4 - 2.4 Evaluation of TR Systems (00-10-10).srt
text: And this is usually done through test collection.

name: 3 - 4 - 2.4 Evaluation of TR Systems (00-10-10).srt
text: And this is the main idea that we'll be talking about in this course.

name: 3 - 4 - 2.4 Evaluation of TR Systems (00-10-10).srt
text: This has been very important for comparing different algorithms and

name: 3 - 4 - 2.4 Evaluation of TR Systems (00-10-10).srt
text: for improving search engines systems in general.

name: 3 - 4 - 2.4 Evaluation of TR Systems (00-10-10).srt
text: So next we will talk about what to measure.

name: 3 - 4 - 2.4 Evaluation of TR Systems (00-10-10).srt
text: _There are many aspects of a search engine we can measure
column6: we can evaluate and _

name: 3 - 4 - 2.4 Evaluation of TR Systems (00-10-10).srt
text: here I list the three major aspects.

name: 3 - 4 - 2.4 Evaluation of TR Systems (00-10-10).srt
text: _One is effectiveness or accuracy
column6: how accurate are the search results? _

name: 3 - 4 - 2.4 Evaluation of TR Systems (00-10-10).srt
text: In this case we're measuring a system's capability of ranking relevant documents

name: 3 - 4 - 2.4 Evaluation of TR Systems (00-10-10).srt
text: on top of non relevant ones.

name: 3 - 4 - 2.4 Evaluation of TR Systems (00-10-10).srt
text: The second is efficiency.

name: 3 - 4 - 2.4 Evaluation of TR Systems (00-10-10).srt
text: How quickly can a user get the results?

name: 3 - 4 - 2.4 Evaluation of TR Systems (00-10-10).srt
text: How much computing resources are needed to answer a query?

name: 3 - 4 - 2.4 Evaluation of TR Systems (00-10-10).srt
text: So in this case we need to measure the space and time overhead of the system.

name: 3 - 4 - 2.4 Evaluation of TR Systems (00-10-10).srt
text: The third aspect is usability.

name: 3 - 4 - 2.4 Evaluation of TR Systems (00-10-10).srt
text: Basically the question is how useful is the system for real user tasks?

name: 3 - 4 - 2.4 Evaluation of TR Systems (00-10-10).srt
text: _Here
column6: obviously
column7: interfaces and many other things are also important and _

name: 3 - 4 - 2.4 Evaluation of TR Systems (00-10-10).srt
text: we typically would have to do user studies.

name: 3 - 4 - 2.4 Evaluation of TR Systems (00-10-10).srt
text: _Now
column6: in this course

name: 3 - 4 - 2.4 Evaluation of TR Systems (00-10-10).srt
text: _accuracy measures because
column6: the efficiency and _

name: 3 - 4 - 2.4 Evaluation of TR Systems (00-10-10).srt
text: _usability dimensions are
column6: not really unique to search engines

name: 3 - 4 - 2.4 Evaluation of TR Systems (00-10-10).srt
text: _they are
column6: needed for evaluating any other software systems. _

name: 3 - 4 - 2.4 Evaluation of TR Systems (00-10-10).srt
text: And there is also good coverage of such materials in other courses.

name: 3 - 4 - 2.4 Evaluation of TR Systems (00-10-10).srt
text: _But how to evaluate a search engine is quite
column6: you know accuracy is _

name: 3 - 4 - 2.4 Evaluation of TR Systems (00-10-10).srt
text: _something you need to text retrieval
column6: and we're going to talk a lot about this. _

name: 3 - 4 - 2.4 Evaluation of TR Systems (00-10-10).srt
text: _The main idea that people have proposed before using a attitude
column6: evaluate _

name: 3 - 4 - 2.4 Evaluation of TR Systems (00-10-10).srt
text: _a text retrieval algorithm
column6: is called the Cranfield Evaluation Methodology. _

name: 3 - 4 - 2.4 Evaluation of TR Systems (00-10-10).srt
text: _This one actually was developed long time ago
column6: developed in the 1960s. _

name: 3 - 4 - 2.4 Evaluation of TR Systems (00-10-10).srt
text: _It's a methodology for laboratory test of system components
column6: it's actually _

name: 3 - 4 - 2.4 Evaluation of TR Systems (00-10-10).srt
text: _a methodology that has been very useful
column6: not just for search engine evaluation. _

name: 3 - 4 - 2.4 Evaluation of TR Systems (00-10-10).srt
text: But also for evaluating virtually all kinds of empirical tasks.

name: 3 - 4 - 2.4 Evaluation of TR Systems (00-10-10).srt
text: _And
column6: for example in processing or in other fields where the problem _

name: 3 - 4 - 2.4 Evaluation of TR Systems (00-10-10).srt
text: is empirically defined we typically would need to use to use such a methodology.

name: 3 - 4 - 2.4 Evaluation of TR Systems (00-10-10).srt
text: And today was the big data challenge with the use of machine learning every where.

name: 3 - 4 - 2.4 Evaluation of TR Systems (00-10-10).srt
text: _We general
column6: this methodology has been very popular
column7: but it was first developed for _

name: 3 - 4 - 2.4 Evaluation of TR Systems (00-10-10).srt
text: search engine application in the 1960s.

name: 3 - 4 - 2.4 Evaluation of TR Systems (00-10-10).srt
text: So the basic idea of this approach is it'll build a reusable test collections

name: 3 - 4 - 2.4 Evaluation of TR Systems (00-10-10).srt
text: and define measures.

name: 3 - 4 - 2.4 Evaluation of TR Systems (00-10-10).srt
text: Once such a test collection is build it can be used again and

name: 3 - 4 - 2.4 Evaluation of TR Systems (00-10-10).srt
text: again to test the different algorithms.

name: 3 - 4 - 2.4 Evaluation of TR Systems (00-10-10).srt
text: And we're going to define measures that would allow you to quantify

name: 3 - 4 - 2.4 Evaluation of TR Systems (00-10-10).srt
text: _performance of a system or an
column6: an algorithm. _

name: 3 - 4 - 2.4 Evaluation of TR Systems (00-10-10).srt
text: So how exactly would this work?

name: 3 - 4 - 2.4 Evaluation of TR Systems (00-10-10).srt
text: _Well
column6: we're going to do
column7: have assembled collection of documents and _

name: 3 - 4 - 2.4 Evaluation of TR Systems (00-10-10).srt
text: this is just similar to real document collection in your search application.

name: 3 - 4 - 2.4 Evaluation of TR Systems (00-10-10).srt
text: We can also have a sample set of queries or topics.

name: 3 - 4 - 2.4 Evaluation of TR Systems (00-10-10).srt
text: This is to simulate the user's queries.

name: 3 - 4 - 2.4 Evaluation of TR Systems (00-10-10).srt
text: Then we'll have to have relevance judgments.

name: 3 - 4 - 2.4 Evaluation of TR Systems (00-10-10).srt
text: These are judgments of which documents should be returned for which queries.

name: 3 - 4 - 2.4 Evaluation of TR Systems (00-10-10).srt
text: _Ideally
column6: they have to made by users who formulated the queries _

name: 3 - 4 - 2.4 Evaluation of TR Systems (00-10-10).srt
text: because those are the people that know exactly what documents would be used for.

name: 3 - 4 - 2.4 Evaluation of TR Systems (00-10-10).srt
text: And then finally we have to have measures to quantify how well a system's result

name: 3 - 4 - 2.4 Evaluation of TR Systems (00-10-10).srt
text: matches the ideal ranked list.

name: 3 - 4 - 2.4 Evaluation of TR Systems (00-10-10).srt
text: That would be constructed and based on users' relevant judgements.

name: 3 - 4 - 2.4 Evaluation of TR Systems (00-10-10).srt
text: So this methodology is very useful for starting retrieval

name: 3 - 4 - 2.4 Evaluation of TR Systems (00-10-10).srt
text: _algorithms because the test can actually
column6: can be reused many times. _

name: 3 - 4 - 2.4 Evaluation of TR Systems (00-10-10).srt
text: And it will also provide a fair comparison for all the methods.

name: 3 - 4 - 2.4 Evaluation of TR Systems (00-10-10).srt
text: _We have the same criteria
column6: same data set to use and _

name: 3 - 4 - 2.4 Evaluation of TR Systems (00-10-10).srt
text: to compare different algorithms.

name: 3 - 4 - 2.4 Evaluation of TR Systems (00-10-10).srt
text: _This allows us to compare a new algorithm with an old algorithm

name: 3 - 4 - 2.4 Evaluation of TR Systems (00-10-10).srt
text: that was the method of many years ago.

name: 3 - 4 - 2.4 Evaluation of TR Systems (00-10-10).srt
text: By using the same standard.

name: 3 - 4 - 2.4 Evaluation of TR Systems (00-10-10).srt
text: _So this is the illustration of how this works
column6: so _

name: 3 - 4 - 2.4 Evaluation of TR Systems (00-10-10).srt
text: _as I said
column6: we need a queries that are shown here. _

name: 3 - 4 - 2.4 Evaluation of TR Systems (00-10-10).srt
text: _We have Q1
column6: Q2

name: 3 - 4 - 2.4 Evaluation of TR Systems (00-10-10).srt
text: _We also need a documents
column6: and that's called the document collection

name: 3 - 4 - 2.4 Evaluation of TR Systems (00-10-10).srt
text: _and on the right side
column6: you see we need relevance judgment. _

name: 3 - 4 - 2.4 Evaluation of TR Systems (00-10-10).srt
text: These are basically the binary judgments of documents with respect to a query.

name: 3 - 4 - 2.4 Evaluation of TR Systems (00-10-10).srt
text: _So
column6: for example D1 is judged as being relevant to Q1

name: 3 - 4 - 2.4 Evaluation of TR Systems (00-10-10).srt
text: D2 is judged as being relevant as well.

name: 3 - 4 - 2.4 Evaluation of TR Systems (00-10-10).srt
text: _And D3 is judged as non relevant in the two
column6: Q1

name: 3 - 4 - 2.4 Evaluation of TR Systems (00-10-10).srt
text: These would be created by users.

name: 3 - 4 - 2.4 Evaluation of TR Systems (00-10-10).srt
text: _Once we have these
column6: and we basically have a test

name: 3 - 4 - 2.4 Evaluation of TR Systems (00-10-10).srt
text: _then
column6: if you have two systems

name: 3 - 4 - 2.4 Evaluation of TR Systems (00-10-10).srt
text: Then you can just run each system on these queries and

name: 3 - 4 - 2.4 Evaluation of TR Systems (00-10-10).srt
text: documents and each system will then return results.

name: 3 - 4 - 2.4 Evaluation of TR Systems (00-10-10).srt
text: _Let's say if the query is Q1 and then we would have the results here

name: 3 - 4 - 2.4 Evaluation of TR Systems (00-10-10).srt
text: here I show R sub A as results from system A.

name: 3 - 4 - 2.4 Evaluation of TR Systems (00-10-10).srt
text: _So
column6: this is remember we talked about task of computing approximation of the

name: 3 - 4 - 2.4 Evaluation of TR Systems (00-10-10).srt
text: relevant document setter.

name: 3 - 4 - 2.4 Evaluation of TR Systems (00-10-10).srt
text: _So A is
column6: the system A's approximation here

name: 3 - 4 - 2.4 Evaluation of TR Systems (00-10-10).srt
text: also B is system B's approximation of relevant documents.

name: 3 - 4 - 2.4 Evaluation of TR Systems (00-10-10).srt
text: Now let's take a look at these results.

name: 3 - 4 - 2.4 Evaluation of TR Systems (00-10-10).srt
text: So which is better?

name: 3 - 4 - 2.4 Evaluation of TR Systems (00-10-10).srt
text: Now imagine for a user which one would you like?

name: 3 - 4 - 2.4 Evaluation of TR Systems (00-10-10).srt
text: All right lets take a look at both results.

name: 3 - 4 - 2.4 Evaluation of TR Systems (00-10-10).srt
text: And there are some differences and

name: 3 - 4 - 2.4 Evaluation of TR Systems (00-10-10).srt
text: there are some documents that are return to both systems.

name: 3 - 4 - 2.4 Evaluation of TR Systems (00-10-10).srt
text: _But if you look at the results you will feel that well

name: 3 - 4 - 2.4 Evaluation of TR Systems (00-10-10).srt
text: maybe an A is better in the sense that we don't have many number in documents.

name: 3 - 4 - 2.4 Evaluation of TR Systems (00-10-10).srt
text: _And among the three documents returned the two of them are relevant
column6: so _

name: 3 - 4 - 2.4 Evaluation of TR Systems (00-10-10).srt
text: _that's good
column6: it's precise. _

name: 3 - 4 - 2.4 Evaluation of TR Systems (00-10-10).srt
text: On the other hand can also say maybe B is better because

name: 3 - 4 - 2.4 Evaluation of TR Systems (00-10-10).srt
text: _we've got more relevant documents
column6: we've got three instead of two. _

name: 3 - 4 - 2.4 Evaluation of TR Systems (00-10-10).srt
text: So which one is better and how do we quantify this?

name: 3 - 4 - 2.4 Evaluation of TR Systems (00-10-10).srt
text: _Well obviously
column6: this question highly depends on a user's task. _

name: 3 - 4 - 2.4 Evaluation of TR Systems (00-10-10).srt
text: _And
column6: it depends on users as well. _

name: 3 - 4 - 2.4 Evaluation of TR Systems (00-10-10).srt
text: _You might be able to imagine
column6: for some users may be system made is better. _

name: 3 - 4 - 2.4 Evaluation of TR Systems (00-10-10).srt
text: _If the user is not interested in getting all the relevant documents

name: 3 - 4 - 2.4 Evaluation of TR Systems (00-10-10).srt
text: _right
column6: in this case this is the user doesn't have to read. _

name: 3 - 4 - 2.4 Evaluation of TR Systems (00-10-10).srt
text: User would see most relevant documents.

name: 3 - 4 - 2.4 Evaluation of TR Systems (00-10-10).srt
text: _On the other hand on one count
column6: imagine user might need to have _

name: 3 - 4 - 2.4 Evaluation of TR Systems (00-10-10).srt
text: _as many relevant documents as possible
column6: for example

name: 3 - 4 - 2.4 Evaluation of TR Systems (00-10-10).srt
text: _You might be in the second category
column6: and _

name: 3 - 4 - 2.4 Evaluation of TR Systems (00-10-10).srt
text: then you might find that system B's better.

name: 3 - 4 - 2.4 Evaluation of TR Systems (00-10-10).srt
text: _So in either case
column6: we'll have to also define measures that would quantify them. _

name: 3 - 4 - 2.4 Evaluation of TR Systems (00-10-10).srt
text: And we might need to define multiple measures because

name: 3 - 4 - 2.4 Evaluation of TR Systems (00-10-10).srt
text: users have different perspectives of looking at results.
